website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX10 IV camera delivers an incredible zoom range and uses a stacked sensor design and phase detection focus for 24fps image capture.

Can't start a video when still buffer is in use

customer_reviews.title: Beware.  Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I owned this camera for less than a year and used it alongside my three Canon DSLRs ( 5D, 7D, 10D). The camera failed and I sent it to Sony for repair but they concluded it was not repairable due to "corrosion". None of the Canon's have had a problem so I know the camera wasn't exposed to any harsh or unusually corrosive environments. This was a great and handy camera until it failed but from my experience I would be suspicious of the build quality and environmental protection of these cameras compared to more established brands like Canon. Warranty is only six months so as far as Sony are concerned this is not their problem.
customer_reviews.author: Longwinter

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the nature photographer
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur photographer who takes almost all his pix while hiking or kayaking. I want the maximum capability from a minimum of equipment. I don't want to change lenses, but I do a lot of animal photography from a distance--before they spot me! In the kayak especially, I can't be fussing around with tripod or monopod, I need to shoot as soon as I see a shot. The Sony RX10 IV gives me that capability, and excellent photographs.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Image Quality, Fast Focusing, Great Zoom.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Easily the best camera of any type in its price range. The focus is so fast, it feels instant. The 24-600mm zoom is so long it feels like it never quits, and the image stabilization keeps up with the long zoom. The focus limiter (infinity - 3m) is very useful. I love the small batteries. They are the same ones my Sony a6000 uses. Third party batteries are cheap. Buy them with a double charger. Look for "B01HFOJUCW". Criticisms: It weighs as much as my DSLR, but what do you expect with this huge zoom? I wish the 24mm wide angle was wider. The 4K video isn't well stabilized, shoot 1080p video instead.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dunay

customer_reviews.title: Great but for daytime only
customer_reviews.text: It's been three weeks with this baby. First, I bought it because of its weight, zoom and image stabilization. I do stills only. And I have been trying it in Lima during winter... that means, darkish and humid. It is a VERY GOOD camera, let's get clear about that. However, already at dusk time, its performance is poor. If you increase the ISO beyond 800... it could be lighter but very very grainy. So, I will try it at night with long exposure and I'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Marx Lives

customer_reviews.title: Camera is amazing at focusing and great IQ
customer_reviews.text: Camera is amazing at focusing and great IQ, handles everything on its own. It has almost all the functions you get in A7 full frame range cameras including Bionz processor. I bought A7III and returned it in favor of this one. if you are enthusiast or prosumer you won;t be disappointed by awesome zoon and wide in the single lens. This is the best travel camera you can get.

Not the same of course, as it only has a one inch sensor, but for my needs this should work well, and it's sooo much smaller and easier to transport.

Only problem with order was that I had it sent to my work address to make sure it was safe and discovered the boxes got left outside the back door. It was suppose to be signed for but I don't think it ever was. Not a good idea for a $1500 camera.

customer_reviews.title: This camera is crazy expenisve but it is the undisputed king of bridge cameras.

Its an amazing camera with many great features although the menus can be a bit tedious and confusing. If you have the money to spend buy this one with no hesitation but if its out of your budget (its very very expensive in its group) opt for the cheaper competitors like Nikon P950 or Lumic FX2500.

customer_reviews.title: it's been great for the Moto GP event I recently attended

Although I'm still learning how it will fit into my camera needs, it's been great for the Moto GP event I recently attended. It's plenty fast for capturing the high speed event. And with the long reach for the zoom is really the cherry on top. I have a vacation coming up that I plan to use this as my daily carry camera, and I'm excited to see how well it performs.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bridge camera!!

Grandkids are back in focus (they keep getting faster or I am getting older) and I can capture both running dogs and passing birds. Highly recommended.
